title: Derivatives Sales Trader Intern: Summer 2025
description:
Susquehanna Financial Group, LLLP (SFG) is part of the market-share leader in the listed options market and ETF marketplace globally. Delivering liquidity, derivatives strategy, and fundamental equity research, we partner with our growing client base comprised of mutual funds, hedge funds and pension/endowment funds, by impacting their investment process and helping them perform in the marketplace.  

As an Intern in SFG’s Derivatives Sales Program, you will be embedded in our derivatives sales trading group where you will be trained to understand the options markets and the decision-making strategies that our traders employ. You will learn how to engage with the client base and how to best execute order flow, and how to deliver market-based insights from our derivatives strategy, market intelligence, and equity research teams. In addition to Susquehanna’s industry-leading options education, interns will also have exposure to our ETF and cash desks. You will learn how to cultivate client relationships, understand client needs and to match them with firm resources, and how to create partnerships.  

The job offers excellent, in-depth exposure to a Wall Street financial services firm and provides a strong career path in derivatives sales trading. We are looking for students with a passion for investment finance and an interest in the financial markets.  

The ten-week summer program serves as our primary hiring source for our full-time Derivatives Sales Development Program. **What we're looking for**  

* Intention to graduate with a bachelor’s or master’s degree within one year of the internship program
* Strong quantitative and analytical skills
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office suite, specifically Excel
* Strong communication skills and the ability to interact effectively with all levels of the organization
* Attention to detail and the ability to handle multiple tasks in a fast-paced environment
* Interest in financial markets and, specifically, equity derivatives
* Visa sponsorship for work authorization is not available for this position now or in the future

  

Derivative Sales Trader Interns will receive an annual base compensation of $100,000 prorated for the time worked at Susquehanna. In addition to a signing bonus, Interns will also receive company-paid housing, breakfast and lunch, and other perks.  

Susquehanna does not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or search firms. Any resume or referral submitted in the absence of a signed agreement will become the property of Susquehanna and no fee will be paid.

title: Assistant Property Manager
description:
**Overview**

Rose Associates is your gateway to innovative real estate solutions. With nearly a century of expertise since 1925, we're a leading force in New York City's dynamic market. Join us as an Assistant Community Manager, supporting our vibrant residential communities. Excitement meets opportunity here!

**Essential Job Functions**

* Address resident requests, complaints, and inquiries according to contract standards.
* Act as a liaison between ownership and residents, drafting and distributing communications.
* Cultivate positive relationships among residents, management, and staff.
* Assist in financial analysis, budgeting, and compliance paperwork.
* Manage office supplies and monitor agreements for compliance.
* Ensure delinquency stays below 0.5% of GPR through monthly reporting.
* Coordinate community inspections, Move In/Move Out schedules, and insurance certificates.
* Aid in data entry and post-move out walk-throughs.
* Collaborate with property management on renovations and repairs.
* Conduct leasing demonstrations and manage lease administration.
* Enforce lease terms and maintain market intelligence for occupancy goals.
* Supervise resident retention programs and collaborate internally.
* Be available for emergencies and ensure insurance compliance.
* Maintain on-site presence for community matters and communication.
* Ability to navigate stairs and adapt to varying environments.

title: Bi-Lingual Environmental Health and Safety Specialist (EHS)
description:
**GENERAL PURPOSE**

This role is responsible for supporting Legrand | AV’s Health, Safety and Environmental programs to ensure operations minimize the impact to provide a safe and incident-free workplace. Responsible for leading and supporting the development and implementation of the Safety & Health culture throughout by leveraging technical support, program development, and relationship building. Plan and deliver programs to train managers and employees in work site safety. Analyze data to identify trends and incident types that can be prevented and implement corrective action.

**DUTIES AND ACCOUNTABILITIES**

* Applies EHS practices to develop, implement and manage processes and systems. Develops best practices to drive and create a best in class culture. Provides comprehensive EHS support to the Operations team in regulatory compliance, program development and implementation, documentation, and reporting.
* Communicates the EHS vision and performance to internal and external stakeholders.
* Monitors federal, state, regional, and local safety and environmental regulations for impact and effective application within the manufacturing site(s).
* Management and reporting responsibility for all environmental operating permits
* Helps develops policies, programs and implementation strategies for Da-lite EH&S.
* Collaborates with Middle Atlantic Product teams to ensure EHS requirements are implemented.
* Provides leadership to achieve the EHS vision, partnering with AV management.
* Conducts site risk assessments to determine and document impact to Middle Atlantic Product staff and coordinates risk reduction strategies.
* Implements and maintains EHS training program including: identification of training requirements, coordination of training sessions, training development and presentation.
* Implements Legrand EHS Business (LNCA) & Corporate (Group) processes and systems.
* Supports site needs or requests with regulatory inspections or audits.
* Implements record management and retention policies to comply with regulatory requirements and corporate standards.
* Audits all US based Middle Atlantic Product Operations and assists with corrective actions as applicable.
* Identifies risks associated with the management of Legrand contractors located onMiddle Atlantic Product premises.
* Creates reports to assist with compliance of environmental/safety regulations and sustainability goals.
* Initiate and assist with the creation, development, and implementation of processes and procedures
* Consistently support compliance by maintaining the privacy and confidentiality of information, protecting the assets of the organization, acting with ethics and integrity, reporting non-compliance, and adhering to applicable federal, state and local laws and regulations, and the Company’s policies and procedures
* Understand workplace hazards and take steps to proactively prevent and report hazards or injuries in the workplace. Cooperate in safety programs, initiatives, and investigations.
* Demonstrate our core values of Customer, People, Integrity, Teamwork, Continuous Learning & Improvement, and Empowerment & Accountability

**JOB REQUIREMENTS**

**Essential Knowledge, Skills and Abilities Required:** 

* Excellent interpersonal, oral presentation and written communication skills including the ability to make and deliver training presentations; professional presence and behavior
* Ability to operate/work in an high growth & entrepreneurial environment
* Proficient in the use of personal computers, internet and MS Office suite of software including Word, PowerPoint, Excel, SharePoint, and Outlook (or related e-mail system) to support EHS communication, reporting and analytics.
* Ability to work in a team environment, and leverage additional resources as needed
* Proven broad knowledge of environmental, occupational health, and safety regulations (OSHA/EPA/NFPA).
* Demonstrated leadership, influencing, coaching and collaboration skills.
* Self-motivated and able to work independently to find solutions.
* Must be able to function in a deadline driven environment
* Proven ability to make sound decisions to effectively resolve problems or issues, by using judgment that is consistent with standards, practices, policies, procedures, regulation or government law
* Excellent project management, planning, and organizational skills with the ability to effectively manage several projects at one time while providing high attention to details and excellent follow-through skills
* Must possess high degree of professionalism and ability to handle confidential information
* Bi-Lingual (Spanish/English)

**Minimum Education and Experience Required:**

* Bachelor’s degree in Occupational Safety and Health or Environmental Sciences or other related technical degree with five (5) years’ of professional EHS experience; or combination of relevant education and experience.
* Demonstrated experience in the application of EHS management systems.

**Special Job Requirements:**

* Must be available for extended, varied work hours based on business need

**Preferred Qualifications:**

* Professional Certifications (CSP, ASP, CHMM)
* Basic knowledge of sustainability (CSR)
* Experience with ISO 14001 and/or 45001

**WORKING CONDITIONS/PHYSICAL DEMANDS**

* While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required (for the majority of the working day) to sit and make coordinated movements of the fingers for data entry on a keyboard.
* Ability to lift up to 40 pounds
* Mix of general office environment and regular shop assembly/distribution center environment (no air conditioning)
* Steel-toed shoes are required for working in this position.
* May require regular ground travel to other company facilities
* Long-distance or air travel as needed – not to exceed 10% travel

*Note: Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.*

*Legrand is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. You will be considered for this position based upon your experience and education, without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, ancestry; marital, disabled or veteran status. We are committed to creating and maintaining a workforce environment that is free from any form of discrimination or harassment.*

If you'd like to work in a fun, creative, business-casual environment that offers a comprehensive benefit package, we encourage you to apply!

Legrand is an equal employment opportunity employer.

For California residents, please see the link for the Privacy Notice for Candidates. California law requires that we provide you this notice about the collection and use of your personal Information.

Our schools support all aspects of children’s growth and development in a safe and nurturing environment. BeAbove provides a sound educational foundation for children’s academic growth. title: Certified Home Health Aide
description:
**Vitality Hospice & Palliative Care is seeking an exceptional Home Health Aide to join our team!** This is a terrific opportunity to work for a clinician-owned and operated hospice agency that cares about its patients, and its employees. We offer a positive, upbeat work environment where the interdisciplinary team works together to improve symptom burden and quality of life for patients and caregivers. If caring for those on their end-of-life journey speaks to you, we would love to have you on our team!

Position is Full Time Home Health Aide position, Monday through Friday, typically 7am-3pm with occasional overtime offered on evenings/weekends.

**\\*Must have the required Home Health Aide certification to be considered for this traveling CHHA position\\*** 

**Responsibilities:**

As a Certified Home Health Aide (CHHA), you will work in collaboration and under the supervision of a Registered Nurse Case Manager. As a Home Health Aide you will put your skills to work in support of daily activities that may include assisting patients with getting in and out of bed, dressing, grooming, hygiene, feeding, assistance with ambulatory transfers, and light housekeeping. The nurturer you are, will provide emotional support and companionship to patients. The role requires team members to travel throughout the surrounding areas to patients to provide care.

We are looking for customer service-minded, compassionate, and DEPENDABLE team members. **LOOKING TO HIRE IMMEDIATELY!**

**Benefits:**

* Comprehensive Health, Dental, & Vision Insurance
* Company matching 401(k) to secure your future
* Paid Time Off/Holiday Pay
* Year-end bonuses and periodic situational bonuses based on performance
* Company sponsored team appreciation events
* Mileage reimbursement

* Professional development and career growth opportunities

**Qualifications:**

* Must have a valid drivers’ license with reliable transportation and liability insurance
* Self-directing with the ability to work with little direct supervision
* Empathy for the needs of the ill, injured, frail and the impaired
* Strong communication and interpersonal skills
* Ability to read and follow written instructions and document care given
* Good time management skills and ability to deliver documentation timely

If you meet these qualifications, we want to meet you!

title: 2024-2025 Elementary Learning Specialist (LIC)
description:
**2024-2025 Elementary Learning Specialist (LIC)**


**Mission Statement:** The Growing Up Green Charter School (GUGCS) supports children to be conscious, contributing members of their community through a rigorous, anti-racist, anti-bias, curriculum and an engaging green culture. Graduates of GUGCS will be prepared to attend high-performing schools where their interdisciplinary academic foundation, knowledge of sustainability, and strong sense of self sets them apart as leaders and social justice advocates of the future.


**Instructional Responsibilities:**
* Provide literacy and math small group instruction to students mandated for Special Education Teacher Support Services (SETSS), as well as intervention support for students identified as "at-risk"

* Utilize a variety of specialized curricula to develop a long-term individualized scope & sequence for small group instruction
* Assess student progress with a variety of methods in order to ensure progression towards individualized goals
* Collaborate with classroom teachers and related service providers in order to align and differentiate instruction


* Participate in weekly RTI meetings to develop strategies and interventions for struggling students
* Support classroom teachers to implement intervention plans, as well as monitoring student progress
* Prepare documentation of student's current academic performance in preparation for attendance at IEP meetings
* Administer regular assessment of student IEP goals and complete IEP goal progress reports on a quarterly basis
* Develop individualized SMART goals for student IEPs


**IEP Coordination**
* Collaborate with Director of Support Services to coordinate all mandated special education services in accordance with student IEPs
* Collaborate with Director of Support Services to coordinate and facilitate IEP meetings, including informing teachers, providers, and families in a timely manner and compiling all necessary paperwork and data
* Collaborate with the Director of Support Services with submitting initial referrals or re-evaluation requests to CSE and ensuring CSE compliance with the referral timeline
* Communicate regularly with teachers and service providers to discuss recommendations for appropriate levels of services in advance of IEP meetings
* Ensure modifications made to student IEP services are implemented in a timely manner

* Ensure high quality, detailed, and accurate student IEPs and and SMART goals
* Gather related service progress reports and summarize progress with families when providers are unable to attend IEP meetings
* Collaborate with Assessment Coordinators to ensure students receive mandated testing accommodations
* Provide families with information and guidance regarding evaluation procedures, timeline, and due process rights
* Create and maintain up-to-date classroom service schedules
* Facilitate IEP team meetings to discuss students of concern and plan next steps to support their learning


**Response to Intervention**
* In collaboration with the Director of Support Services, oversee and manage the RtI process by developing, refining, and implementing protocols for SSC (Successful Students Committee)
* Conduct baseline assessments and/or classroom observations for students referred to SSC
* Maintain detailed records by keeping SSC tracker up to date and ensuring that student cases are regularly reviewed through follow up meetings
* Facilitate weekly SSC meetings to develop individualized intervention plans and student goals
* Provide support and feedback for classroom teachers and/or intervention teachers implementing intervention plans
* Ensure consistent data collection and progress monitoring within each tiered level of intervention support

**Other Responsibilities**
* Maintain internal database containing student IEP information, as well as an internal database of IEPs accessible to select staff members
* Support Director of Support Services to update student service information for per pupil invoicing

* Support Director of Support Services in finalizing budgetary projections
* Coordinate the distribution of IEP goal progress reports on a quarterly basis
* Maintain an active lending library of instructional resources, sensory tools, and professional development books for students, classroom teachers, and support services staff members


**School-Wide Responsibilities:**
* Utilize the Responsive Classroom approach to discipline and community-building
* Establish and maintain ongoing positive relationships and communication with families
* Actively participate in school community through weekly staff meetings, PD opportunities, staff committees, and school events
* Work with instructional coach on improving teaching practices throughout the year
* Respond productively to ongoing, year-round professional feedback
* Use weekly lesson plans to help drive instruction in a clear manner
* Demonstrate commitment to working with diverse populations of families and students

**Minimum Qualifications:**


* Strong commitment to Growing Up Green Charter School's mission and green theme
* Strong commitment to a multi-sensory teaching approach
* Demonstrates the ability to work collaboratively with a team of teachers
* Demonstrates initiative and flexibility in scheduling changes to meet all student needs
* Experience in environmental education a plus
* Experience with technology integration
* Excellent organizational skills
* Starting salary is $61,070 (salary scale commensurate with experience)


**Education:**


* Bachelor's Degree required; Master's Degree preferred
* At least two-year experience teaching students in elementary school grades
  


**Required Certificates & Licenses:**


* NY Teaching certification,
* Teaching Certificate in Students with Disability required
* NYC DOE/Fingerprinting & Background Clearance

title: Warehouse Lead
description:
**Warehouse Lead Job Description**

Filling in the Blanks is a nonprofit dedicated to fighting childhood hunger by providing children in need with meals on the weekends.

The Warehouse Lead position requires a self-starter that is comfortable with public speaking and leading groups of volunteers that come to pack weekend meals.

You will report to the Warehouse Manager and work with the operations team to coordinate all matters concerning warehouse operations.

**Warehouse Lead Responsibilities**

As a Warehouse Lead, you'll play a key role in all aspects of warehouse operations and embrace a culture of neatness and exacting standards. Applicant should have a positive attitude, willingness to learn, team player, and the ability to pivot to various jobs as needed in relation to warehouse work.

As a Warehouse Lead you will also:

* Unload, organize, and stock the warehouse racks and tables.
* Help keep the warehouse running smoothly, receiving and logging products for inventory.
* You'll be active, on your feet, and working in a fast-paced environment.
* You will unload trucks.
* Sort products in the warehouse.
* Ensure the warehouse is clean, organized, and safe.
* You will be required to lift 50 Lbs., bend and pick up items.
* Forklift operation
* Position is Tuesday to Saturday 8:00am-4:00pm.
* A background check and 3 work related references will be required before employment but not before the interview process.

**Remote and in-person interview process.**

**Personal Attributes**

Excellent oral communication skills and positive interpersonal skills; a team builder able to motivate others.

Engage volunteers and vendors with a friendly smile and a positive attitude.

Self-starter willing to get the job done.

Excellent problem-solving skills and leadership qualities.

Ability to work with all levels of company staff.

Comfortable delivering frequent direct written and oral feedback.

**Uniform**

Employee’s own clothing, so long as it meets the company dress code.

**Education Requirements**

Minimum of High school diploma/GED preferred but not required

**Experience**

3+ years of warehouse experience preferred but not required.

Bilingual applicants are strongly encouraged but not required.

Previous non-profit employment a plus but not required.

Forklift operating certified preferred.

**Work Remotely**

No

**Benefits**

The chance to kickstart a new career, develop intimate knowledge of the non-profit world, help children in need and master customer service skills.

Eligibility for performance-based bonuses.

A talented team who will treat you like family.

Benefits offerings change each year, and eligibility varies.

**About Filling In The Blanks**

Filling In The Blanks was founded by mothers and community activists, Shawnee Knight and Tina Kramer, who created the non-profit as a way to marry their loves of community, children, food and charity. In 2013, Knight and Kramer created Filling In The Blanks which has now expanded to over 200 schools and community centers throughout Fairfield and Westchester Counties and delivered over three million weekend meals to children in low-income households. To learn more about Filling In The Blanks, visit https://www.fillingintheblanks.org/

**Equal Opportunity Employer**

Filling In the Blanks is an equal opportunity employer. All employees will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

title: Mental Health Associate (MHA) Full Time Days/Nights
description:
**Summit Oaks Hospital,** a 126 bed, private acute care hospital and chemical dependency treatment center, located in a picturesque suburban setting, fully accredited (by the Joint Commission), has been providing quality health care to adult, child and adolescent northeastern USA residents, since 1902.Summit Oaks has repeatedly been recognized in U.S. News & World Report, as one of the nation's best behavioral health hospitals.

Both Day and Overnight full time shifts are available. The schedule for day shift includes three 7am - 7pm shifts per week with rotating weekends. The schedule for overnight includes five 11pm - 7am shifts per week with rotating weekends. There is opportunity to pickup additional shifts if interested.

Our **Mental Health Associate (MHA**) position presents an ideal opportunity for an energetic, motivated individual with prior experience working with patients with behavioral health or addictions diagnosis. The Mental Health Associate functions as an active part of the treatment team, providing continuous patient care, supervision, interaction, role modeling, and monitoring patients ranging in age from preschool through geriatrics , depending on the nursing unit assigned. At present, the nursing units include a 28 bed adult psych unit, a 28 bed adult dual diagnosis, a 22 bed child and adolescent unit , a 24 bed detox unit and a 20 bed rehab unit.

-Other MHA duties include taking vital signs, conducting educational groups and responding to codes.

Much more online at: https://summitoakshospital.com/

**Benefits for our Mental Health Associates (MHAs) include:**

* Career development opportunities across UHS and its 300+ locations!
* HealthStream online learning catalogue with plenty of free CEU courses
* Competitive Compensation & Generous Paid Time Off
* Excellent Medical, Dental, Vision and Prescription Drug Plans
* 401(K) with company match and discounted stock plan
* SoFi Student Loan Refinancing Program

**Qualifications**

***Education:*** High School Degree or equivalent; or Certified Nursing Assistant; or Degree from an accredited college or university in social work, psychology, recreational therapy or appropriate therapeutic discipline.

***Experience:*** Two (2) years of related experience, with knowledge of psychiatric patient care techniques with understanding of mental illness, preferred.

***Additional Requirements:*** CPR certification and training in appropriate use of Seclusion and Restraint, within 90 days of employment, and prior to assisting in a restraining process. Completion of Handle With Care training within 90 days of employment.

description:
Attention all child caregivers, teachers, or parents! Do you have an upbeat personality? Do you have a passion for early childhood development? Can you communicate openly and confidently with parents? We are seeking energetic and experienced individuals to lead engaging and interactive "Parent & Me" classes for toddlers aged 18 months to 3 years alongside their parents or guardians. This role involves creating an imaginative and nurturing environment that focuses on early motor skill development, coordination, and bonding through interactive playful activities. By leading the "Parent & Me" classes you will inspire the next generation of children.

*In-Person Hiring Event will be taking place on September 28th!*

***We are looking for a Coordinator for our Leonia program on Saturday mornings, with other session dates, times and locations potentially available, along with cover coach options.*** **The Fall Season lasts 8-10 weeks, with sessions taking place primarily on the weekends. A class is 40 minutes in duration, in blocks of 2 to 3 hours. Successful hires will attend paid training, and receive the full uniform, curriculum and equipment needed for the role.** 

*The ideal candidate will have the following:* 

* Previous childcare, teaching, and/or coaching experience **(Required)**
* Excellent communication skills with parents to engage toddlers
* Patience, creativity, and a passion when teaching young children

*Responsibilities include:* 

* Implement a pre-structured curriculum designed specifically for toddlers and their parents, focusing on fundamental movement skills, coordination, and intro to sports concepts

* Create a positive and inclusive environment, encouraging participation and bonding

title: Home Restoration General Manager
description:
**Job Title: Home Restoration Manager**

**Company: Content Care LLC**

Location: Northern New Jersey

Job Type: Full-Time

**About Us:**

As our company grows, we are looking for a motivated and experienced Home Restoration & Content Packout Manager to join our team. Content Care LLC specializes in providing emergency packout services with a focus on reliability, professionalism, and care. With 15 years of experience in the service industry, we are committed to restoring our clients' belongings with the highest level of attention and detail.

**Job Description:**

We are seeking a dynamic manager to build, train, and lead our Northern New Jersey operations. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in content restoration or the restoration industry, with a proven ability to build and maintain professional networks and manage day-to-day operations.

**- MUST HAVE a minimum of 2-3 years of experience in home restoration / content packout or the broader restoration industry, particularly in the sales aspect of the business.**

**Key Responsibilities:**

1. Business Development:

- Build and maintain relationships with restoration companies, public adjusters, and TPAs through door-to-door meetings and other outreach efforts.

- Participate in BNI meetings and other networking events to generate leads and enhance the company’s presence in the market.

- Utilize online directories, social media, and other platforms to expand the company’s network and business opportunities.

2. Operational Management:

- Oversee daily operations, ensuring efficient and high-quality service delivery.

- Recruit, train, and manage a team of professionals.

- Monitor inventory processes, ensuring accurate documentation and safe storage of clients' belongings.

3. Claims and Insurance Coordination:

- Work closely with insurance companies, utilizing Xactimate to manage and process claims effectively.

- Ensure all operations align with insurance requirements and industry standards.

4. Customer Service:

- Maintain a high level of customer satisfaction by overseeing all aspects of the customer experience.

- Address any issues or concerns promptly to maintain the company’s reputation for excellent service.

**Qualifications:**

**- MUST HAVE a** **minimum of 2-3 years of experience in home restoration** **/ content packout or the broader restoration industry, particularly in the sales aspect of the business.**

- Experience with Xactimate and working with insurance companies on claims is required.

-Inventory management and customer service experience in the packout industry is a must

- Strong networking and relationship-building skills.

- Excellent organizational and leadership abilities.

- Proficiency in inventory management and operational oversight.

- Strong communication skills, both written and verbal.

- High school diploma, college degree or equivalent is a plus;

- Relevant certifications in restoration or content management are a plus, particularly

Water Damage Restoration Technician (WRT)

Fire and Smoke Restoration Technician (FSRT)

**Why Work With Us?**

- Join a company with 15 years of experience in the service industry.

- Competitive salary and performance bonus.

- Opportunity to lead and grow a critical aspect of our business in Northern New Jersey.

- Work in a supportive, team-oriented environment with a commitment to professional development.

**Please send you resume with the best number to reach you.**

\\*Content Care LLC is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: On-Demand Delivery Driver - Cars, SUVs, Pickups, and Sprinter Vans
description:
FRAYT is a logistics company that specializes in providing end-to-end delivery solutions for businesses and retailers across the United States. Our comprehensive logistics services cover both middle-mile and last-mile delivery, enabling our clients to provide their customers with a seamless and efficient delivery experience.

**Join FRAYT as an independent contractor and start earning extra income by delivering packages, using your car, SUV, pickup truck, minivan, cargo van, or Sprinter Van ! FRAYT is a fast-growing on-demand delivery company on a mission to provide superior and flexible logistics services to our ever-expanding customer base.**

**Why Choose FRAYT?**

**Flexibility:** Be your own boss and set your own schedule. Drive whenever you want, as much or as little as you like. FRAYT lets you decide when and where to work.

**Competitive Payouts:** We offer one of the most competitive payout structures in the industry, ensuring that you receive fair and reasonable payment for your services.

**Fast Payments:** Get paid within 24 hours of completing a shipment, providing you with a reliable and consistent source of income.

**US-Based Support:** FRAYT offers US-based support to our drivers, ensuring that you have access to help whenever you need it.

**Easy-to-use App:** With the user-friendly FRAYT Mobile App, you can easily review and accept shipments that match your business preferences and availability.

**Requirements:**

* Valid driver's license
* Proof of personal auto insurance
* Smartphone with internet access and the ability to use the FRAYT app

**Qualifications:**

* Clean driving record
* Reliable vehicle with insurance coverage
* Ability to lift and carry packages weighing up to 50 pounds
* Excellent communication skills
* Ability to work independently

No previous delivery or logistics experience? No problem! Apply today and join the FRAYT Team with your car, SUV, pickup truck, or minivan. Start earning extra cash and enjoy the freedom of working on your own terms.

Get started now! **Download the FRAYT app and sign up to become a driver.** Once approved, you can start delivering and discover how rewarding it can be to drive for FRAYT, making money on your own time, and **driving like a boss.**

title: Court Analyst
company: Mental Hygiene Legal Service, Appellate Division Second Judicial Department
description:
UCS-23 EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY ANNOUNCEMENT

STATE OF NEW YORK UNIFIED COURT SYSTEM

**ANNOUNCEMENT NO. 52449**

**POSITION TITLE:** COURT ANALYST **JG:** 18

**LOCATION:** MENTAL HYGIENE LEGAL SERVICE  
Garden City, Nassau County

**BASE SALARY:** $ 63,083 + $ 4,775 LOCATION PAY

**CLASSIFICATION:** NON-COMPETITIVE/CONFIDENTIAL

**QUALIFICATIONS:** One year in the Assistant Court Analyst title; **or** Bachelor`s degree from accredited college or university and one (1) year of relevant experience; **or** Master`s degree in Public or Business Administration from an accredited college or university; **or** An equivalent combination of education and experience.

**DISTINGUISHING FEATURES OF WORK:** Court Analysts work under direct supervision, individually or on project teams, performing confidential analysis, research, planning, and other related duties in one or more of the following areas: budget development and court finance; personnel administration; resource allocation; and court system management and administration.

**ASSIGNMENT:** This position will provide confidential administrative support primarily for the Special Litigation and Appeals Unit (SLAU). Duties include but are not limited to: assisting the Deputy Chief Attorney in charge of SLAU to actively manage the docket of court cases before it by coordinating the assignment of cases, tracking their status and monitoring compliance with case milestones to ensure strict adherence to filing requirements; creating and/or maintaining spreadsheets, reports or logs regarding case data and information; entering data and comments into the agency’s case management system (MCMS); reviewing and analyzing reports and data from MCMS; preparing and arranging for the filing and/or e-filing of various court documents in the Supreme Court, Appellate Division and Court of Appeals, as well as the federal courts; typing; filing; preparing correspondence for signature; answering telephone calls; preparing travel vouchers and entering them in the Statewide Financial System (SFS); maintaining the appointment calendars of attorneys; training and supervising clerical support staff assigned to SLAU; serving on structured interview panels; arranging meetings; and performing other related duties. Candidates must be proficient in Microsoft Outlook, Microsoft Word, Microsoft Excel and WordPerfect. Punctuality and the ability to work within expedited timeframes, as well as strong interpersonal and organizational skills with close attention to detail, are required. A working knowledge of the New York State Courts Electronic Filing System (NYSCEF), MCMS and SFS is preferred.

**GENERAL INFORMATION:** The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by persons assigned to this title. They do not include all job duties performed by employees in the title, and every position does not necessarily require these duties. Although a position is available and situated at a specific location, the appointee may be subject to reassignment to any position in the same title in this promotion unit dependent upon the needs of the Unified Court System. All applications received from this announcement may be used to fill any vacancies in this title that may occur in this court or agency within the next six (6) months. Position(s) available at the present time: **1** .

**APPLICATION PROCEDURES:** All interested persons meeting the minimum qualifications are encouraged to submit a UCS-5 Application for Employment form (obtainable from any administrative office in a court building or on the web at www.nycourts.gov/careers/UCS5.pdf) and a resume and cover letter.

**APPLICANTS ARE ENCOURAGED TO COMPLETE THE EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY DATA COLLECTION FORM.**

**POSTING DATE:** September 17, 2024

**APPLICATIONS MUST BE RECEIVED BY:** October 15, 2024

**The New York State Unified Court System is an equal opportunity employer, and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, gender (including pregnancy and gender identity or expression), national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, age, membership in an employee organization, parental status, military service, or other non-merit factor.**

* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

* Monday to Friday

title: Outside Sales Representative
description:
**Buffalo Biodiesel Inc. is in growth mode and currently seeking Outside Sales Representatives to join our team!**

Buffalo Biodiesel is seeking Outside Sales Representatives to build relationships and canvass entities with deep fryers to contract for the purchase of their used cooking oils. Currently we operate in 15 states with service to over 22,000 locations. This role is technically a purchasing/business development role. There is no customer service or order taking in this position. No expectations to work holidays or long weekends.

**Qualifications/Requirements:**

* Driver License with Clean Motor Vehicle Report Required.
* Bachelor’s Degree required.
* Minimum 5 years of successful cold calling experience required.
* Master's degree preferred.
* Hard working.
* Reliable.
* Drug free.
* Ability to travel to Canada required.
* Bonus if you are bilingual and are fluent in any of the following languages: Arabic, Spanish, Chinese, Cantonese, Hindi/Bengali.

**Shift:**

* You will canvass locations that are a drive time of no more than 1.5hrs from your designated area or depot location. The company provides both a company car and cell phone. Mandatory working hours are 1st stop by 9am, last stop after 4pm Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Friday. On Thursdays you are required to canvass bars with the 1st stop by 2pm and last stop after 10pm.
* Monday – Friday
* 50+ hours a week.

**Benefits:**

* Company vehicle and phone.
* Medical, Dental, and Vision.
* Matching 401k up to 4% after one year.
* Base pay of $70k plus sales bonuses on every new contract if you hit metrics.
* Reps should make 1x to 2x their base in bonuses for hitting metrics.
* A person who is motivated can easily earn over six figures.

**Who We Are:**

Buffalo Biodiesel Inc. has been in business since 2005. We are a growing company that collects and recycles used cooking oil. We operate in 15 States with service to over 22,000 locations and continue to grow! Buffalo Biodiesel Inc. is subject to and complies with the Federal Drug-Free Workplace Act.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $70,000.00 per year

Benefits:

title: Family Service Worker (Far Rockaway)
description:
BeAbove World Wide Institute Inc. is a nonprofit children’s organization that provides quality Center Based, Home Based and Family childcare for families in the Queens, Brooklyn and Bronx communities. Our schools support all aspects of children’s growth and development in a safe and nurturing environment. BeAbove provides a sound educational foundation for children’s academic growth. Our program provides comprehensive services for children and their families in keeping with our philosophy that the caregiver is the child’s primary teacher.

**This is a 12-month position. Hours are 7:30am-4:30pm**

Agency Wide Duties and Responsibilities:

1. Supports the mission, vision and philosophy of B’Above Worldwide Institute. Complies willingly with all organizational policies and procedures.

2. Supports all functions that attain and maintain accreditation and compliance with regulatory agencies.

3. Exhibits effective communication skills.

4. Provides for own professional growth through an ongoing program of reading, workshops, seminars, conferences, and/or advanced course work at institutions of higher learning.

***General Description***

The Family worker supports family services and family engagement activities. They are responsible for the recruitment, eligibility determination and enrollment of families into the program. They track the placement and discharge of children and ensures that program census is maintained. The Family Worker is responsible for completing files, maintaining partnership with families, family assessments including but not limited to Family Assessments, Nutrition assessments and Child Profiles.

***Position Specific Duties and Responsibilities***

1. Maintains a proper caseload

2. Assists families with eligibility determination and enrollment. Ensures all required documents are completed and filed in program folders.

3. Conduct recruitment activities to ensure program maintain budgeted enrollment

4. Tracks children’s attendance follows up with families on absences

5. Follows up on all overdue medicals, works with parents to ensure submission. Ensures children’s required health and screening records are accurate and current, in accordance with Head Start and DOHMH regulations.

6. Collaborates with community agencies to identify resources for parents.

7. With other staff, plans and facilitates monthly new parent orientation and parent meetings.

8. Partners with families to complete Family Assessments and make referrals as needed to meet identified needs.

9. Assist in facilitating workshops and other activities for family’s children and families.

Other Duties

10. Completes other tasks as assigned

***Position Qualifications:***

1. Minimum of a High School diploma and a Family Development Credential (FDC) Associate Degree in Human Services or related field or Child Development Associate Credential (preferred).

2. Knowledge of Head Start and DOE preferred.

3. Basic competency in Microsoft Office for Windows application is required.

4. Bilingual Spanish speaking (required).

title: Preschool Teacher
description:
BeAbove World Wide Institute Inc. is a nonprofit children’s organization that provides quality Center Based and Home Based childcare for families in the Queens, Brooklyn and Bronx communities. Our schools support all aspects of children’s growth and development in a safe and nurturing environment. BeAbove provides a sound educational foundation for children’s academic growth. Our program provides comprehensive services for children and their families in keeping with our philosophy that the caregiver is the child’s primary teacher.

***All positions are 12-months. Work hours are 8am-4pm or 9am-5pm.***

***Please note: we do not follow all of the same Department of Education (DOE) holidays and school closures.***

**Requirements for Lead Teacher Position:**

* Must have a minimum of a 12 credits in **Early Childhood Education** **and** be currently enrolled in an Associate Degree program or higher in the field of Education **OR** have an Infant-Toddler Child Development Associate Credential (CDA)
* Master’s degree or BA/BS degree in Early Childhood Education or related field is a plus.
* Professional NY State Certification in Early Childhood Education B-2 or Disabilities ECE B-2 (preferred)
* 1 to 2 years’ of experience working with children (ages 2-4). (Preferably in a childcare or school setting)
* Familiarity with Head Start/Early Head Start, the Creative Curriculum, preschool assessments, creating lesson plans, behavior management and early childhood practices.
* Must be willing to complete paperwork including lesson plans, child assessments, child daily logs and classroom logs
* Spanish speaking highly preferred
* Additional center/school requirements may apply

**Job Responsibilities**

* Must be willing to complete paperwork including lesson plans (using the Creative Curriculum), child assessments/screenings, child daily logs and classroom logs.
* Familiarity with the Creative Curriculum (assessments, lesson plans, observations/anecdotal & family reports).
* Provide a safe, positive, creative and nurturing learning environment at all times.
* Guide children to learn language, gain autonomy, interact socially and participate in physical activities.
* Keep parents informed of their child’s progress and growth.
* Assist team members and volunteers in maintaining an orderly, safe and attractive classroom.
* Complete and submit all required paperwork and documentation as scheduled.
* Delegate and assign tasks as described in the job descriptions and program policies.
* Encourage parents to be active participants in their child's education.
* Ensure that all classroom activities are developmentally appropriate and carried out on a daily basis.
* Handle emergency situations as designated by program policies and procedures.
* Provide a setting that meets the individual needs of children, assess each child's developmental needs and write individual lesson plans.
* Flexible, and work with colleagues in a professional manner.
* Love working with young children.
* Support the diversity initiatives of the school.
* Attendance/Punctuality - Is consistently at work and on time; ensures work responsibilities are covered when absent; arrives at meetings and appointments on time.
* Dependability - Follows instructions, responds to management direction; takes responsibility for own actions.
* Judgement - Displays willingness to make decisions; exhibits sound and accurate judgment; supports and explains reasoning for decisions; includes appropriate people in decision-making process; makes timely decisions.
* Ethics - Treats people with respect; keeps commitments; inspires the trust of others; works with integrity and principles; upholds organizational values.
* Organizational Support - Follows policies and procedures; completes administrative tasks correctly and on time; supports organization's goals and values; benefits organization through outside activities.
* Additional center/school requirements may apply.

title: U20 Academy Soccer Coach
description:
The Brooklyn Italians Youth Soccer Club was founded in 1949 by Italian immigrants who settled in Brooklyn after World War II. While the club was founded by Italian immigrants, its history includes all immigrants that came to NYC with dreams of a better life regardless of which corner of the globe they migrated from and had one thing in common – The Beautiful Game. Brooklyn Italians Soccer Club is organized as a 501 c(3) not for profit entity to educate, inspire and promote the development of high quality soccer players in the Brooklyn community. It is an official NY Red Bulls Affiliate club and the sole affiliate in the borough. Our mission since 1949 has been to foster a soccer community that reflects the diversity of Brooklyn, New York. To provide children of all backgrounds, from our youngest players in Scuola Calcio, to competitive boys and girls travel teams an opportunity to develop their passion for the beautiful game and realize their full potential as both players and young adults in NYC’s most populous borough.

We are looking for an experienced coach to lead our U20 Academy soccer team.

Job description/details:

Coaches with the ability to develop players in Brooklyn, NY. Our coaching staff, under the guidance of our DOC Antonio Superbia Jr, is expected to deliver enjoyable programming while maximizing technical and tactical abilities following the NYRB & BI curriculum.

Requirements:

**Priority given for USSF B licensed coach.**

US work authorization required

Proven playing experience (minimum high school level)

Ability to communicate effectively with players and parents

A minimum of 1 USSF Grassroots course (4x4/7x7/9x9/11x11).

United Soccer Coaches Diploma/USSF licenses a plus.

Full commitment for the entire program.

Ability to travel to Calvert Vaux Park 1990 Shore Pkwy, Brooklyn, NY 11214

**Salary Information**

**Pay Rate: TBD, based on coaching and playing experience/badges.**

Pay: From $500.00 per month

* Evenings as needed
* Weekends as needed

title: Lead Low Voltage Technician
description:
The Response Electric Division of The Metro Group is expanding its Low Voltage business and is seeking a motivated, experienced, full-time CCTV, Access Control, Low Voltage Technician. Position requires 7+ years of experience. Applicants should have knowledge of designing, installing, and implementing small to large systems. The applicant will be closely involved in planning and specifying parts necessary for bids and installations while working closely with various team members. Must be able to work with conduit, understand networking, and have installed various types of Access Control and Intercom systems. The applicant should understand all aspects of low voltage type installations.

**Essential functions:**

* Work with conduit, install phone systems, and install various types of Access Control/Intercom systems
* Program CCTV, Alarm, Networking, Intercom and Access Control Systems
* Promptly address and resolve problems/complaints filed by the customer
* Install and troubleshoot products from manufacturers including but not limited to: Keri Systems - Honeywell/Vista/NAPCO/DSC Alarms - Hikvision – TVT - Axis - AIPHONE - Alpha - Comelit – Doorking – OpenEye – Genetec – Milestone – Exaqvision – Crestron – Biamp – Ovrc – Fortinet – Ubiquiti – Cisco - Araknis. The successful applicant with have experience with more than one of these manufacturers. It is not necessary to have experience with all of them, but that would be a plus
* Support and uphold all company policies and procedures, and ensure they are always adhered to

**Qualification Requirements:**

* 7+ years of experience in the low voltage construction industry. Fire alarm expertise is a plus
* Ability to construct structured cabling, security, fire alarm, or other low voltage systems

* Excellent communication skills

title: Ultrasound Tech
description:
Job Title: Ultrasound Technologist

Location: Queens, NY

Blended Rate: $3200/wk

Shift: 5x8s- 40hrs - Evenings/Nights available

We are seeking an experienced and skilled Ultrasound Technologist to join our prestigious medical facility in Queens, NY. As an Ultrasound Technologist, you will play a crucial role in the diagnostic process by performing high-quality ultrasound examinations on patients, producing accurate and detailed images, and providing exceptional patient care.

**Responsibilities:**

* Perform diagnostic ultrasound examinations using medical equipment to visualize internal organs, tissues, and vessels.
* Capture and analyze appropriate diagnostic images and data for interpretation by physicians.
* Ensure accurate image labeling, data entry, and patient records maintenance.
* Collaborate with physicians to provide preliminary findings and assist in the formulation of patient treatment plans.
* Ensure equipment is well-maintained, cleaned, and stocked with necessary supplies.
* Adhere to safety protocols, infection control guidelines, and regulatory standards to ensure patient safety and quality of care.
* Communicate effectively with patients, explaining procedures and ensuring their comfort throughout the examination process.
* Maintain a high level of professionalism and compassion when dealing with patients, colleagues, and other healthcare professionals.
* Keep abreast of industry advancements, new techniques, and equipment to enhance personal knowledge and improve patient care.

**Requirements:**

* Proven working experience as an Ultrasound Technologist.
* Possess a degree in Medical Sonography or a related field.
* Certification in Diagnostic Medical Sonography (ARDMS, ARRT, or equivalent).
* Proficiency in operating and troubleshooting ultrasound equipment.
* Solid understanding of anatomy, physiology, and medical terminology.
* Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
* Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and high-pressure environment.
* Exceptional attention to detail and accuracy.
* Must be able to work flexible schedules, including evenings, weekends, and holidays.

We offer a competitive salary of $3200 weekly, along with a comprehensive benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, retirement plans, and paid time off. Join our dynamic team and contribute to the delivery of excellent patient care at our esteemed medical facility in Queens, NY.

**Working for Seven Healthcare:**

Seven Healthcare is one of the USA's most popular agencies for Ultrasound Technologist jobs. Rated ‘Excellent’ on Trustpilot from 1900+ reviews, and with 20 major awards behind us, we take pride in knowing we can find you the best possible rates in a role you can be proud of.

description:
**Job Description:**

As a Prevocational Service Provider, you will play a pivotal role in preparing youth (ages 14 and older) to engage in paid work, volunteer work, or career exploration. Prevocational Services are not job-specific but are geared towards facilitating success in any work environment. You will teach general work-related skills, such as effective communication, workplace conduct, task completion, punctuality, and problem-solving. Additionally, you will assist with career planning, job readiness activities like resume writing and interview techniques, and explore educational and financial aid opportunities. Your goal is to allow the youth to attain the highest level of work in the most integrated setting with the job matched to their interests, strengths, and priorities.

**Responsibilities:**

* Providing goal-oriented care to clients as developed in the service plan process. (e.g., teach general work-related skills, assist with career planning and job readiness activities like resume writing , and explore educational and financial aid opportunities, etc.)
* Timely documentation of services.
* Adhering to compliance expectations of PSCMH’s Children’s HCBS program.

title: Facilities Custodian
description:
**This role requires working full time on-site at the Skirball Center for Innovation based in Orangeburg, New York.**

**SUMMARY**

Under general supervision, is responsible for cleaning the facility and laboratory areas and assisting in maintaining day-to-day operations of equipment and the facility, as required to keep the facility operating in a safe, compliant and orderly state.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

· Responsible for cleaning the facility and lab areas, including polishing, dusting, mopping, vacuuming, scrubbing and collecting trash from office and lab areas.

· May perform work within multiple maintenance trades (carpentry, painting, electrical, plumbing and mechanical repair). Assists in maintaining day-to-day facility infrastructure, fixing walls, toilets, plumbing, lighting, furniture, equipment, etc.

· Maintains loading dock. Receives parcels, gases, and chemicals.

· Assists with escorting contractors and vendors within the facility.

· Assists in performing routine maintenance tasks to ensure continued safe and compliant state of facility and equipment.

· Assures standard operating procedures are followed.

· Maintains cleanliness of conference rooms, kitchens, and bathrooms.

· Assists with office and furniture moves.

· May be required to perform sanitization and basic husbandry (cleaning, feeding) in the vivarium.

· Additional duties as assigned.

**QUALIFICATIONS**

· High School diploma required.

· 2 years of janitorial/facilities maintenance experience.

· Ability to handle a variety of tasks simultaneously.

· General mechanical skills.

· Prior experience in a vivarium and laboratory environment preferred.

· Strong focus on flexibility, ability to multi-task, attention to detail, excellent organizational skills, good follow-up and judgment. Must be able to prioritize.

· Must possess excellent communication and writing skills, patience, professionalism and ability to effectively interact with staff and management alike.

· Basic knowledge of Microsoft Office, in particular, Outlook, Word and Excel.

· Ability to analyze information and solve problems relating to facilities issues.

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS AND WORK ENVIRONMENT**

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand, walk, crouch, crawl, use hands to touch and feel, reach with hands and arms, talk and listen. The employee is occasionally required to lift up to 50 pounds. The vision requirements include close, distance, and peripheral vision, depth perception, and ability to focus.

The work environment includes the entire inside and the outside of the facility, including an indoor, climate-controlled Vivarium. The lighting is appropriate. The noise level in certain animal areas can be above normal. Working on elevation (ladder) may be occasionally required. There are hazards, and protective gear may be required to be worn or used.

**BENEFITS**

· Choice of health plans include medical, Dental, and vision coverage

· Company-paid short-term and long-term disability and life insurance

· Health and dependent care flexible spending accounts

· Pre-tax travel expenses through TransitChek program

· 401(k) plan

· Ten paid holidays each year

To be considered for this opportunity, please submit your resume.

title: Biostatistician
description:
**This role is subject to a flexible hybrid work arrangement requiring a minimum of 1-2 pre-determined days per week in our mid-town office.**

**SUMMARY**

As a member of clinical trial teams, the Biostatistician role involves a dual focus on programming for clinical trials, particularly for FDA submissions, and conducting statistical analyses for academic research papers aimed at publication in top medical journals. The Biostatistician brings statistical programming expertise to the design, conduct, analysis, and reporting of clinical studies, in the pre-clinical, Phases I to IV, and post-marketing stages of study.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

· Develop and validate statistical code to support the analysis of clinical trial data.

· Collaborate with clinical researchers to prepare and review statistical methods and results for academic publications.

· Ensure compliance with regulatory standards in the preparation of documentation for FDA submissions.

· Participate actively in team meetings and contribute to project planning and strategy discussions.

**QUALIFICATIONS**

· Bachelor’s degree, plus 2-3 years of experience in statistics, biostatistics, computer science or public health.

· Strong understanding of statistical methods and principles relevant to clinical research.

· Must be proficient in statistical programming languages such as R, Stata, Python, SPSS, and SAS.

· Strong focus on flexibility, ability to multi-task, attention to detail, excellent organizational skills, good follow-up and judgment. Must be able to prioritize.

· Excellent communication and collaborative skills.

· Strong problem solving abilities and attention to detail.

· Willingness to engage in continuous learning and skill development.

**BENEFITS**

* Choice of health plans include medical, Dental, and vision coverage
* Company-paid short-term and long-term disability and life insurance

title: Assistant Director of Nursing, PACU
description:
Under direction of the Chief Nursing Officer, with the broadest scope for the exercise of independent initiative and judgment, organizes, directs, coordinates and evaluates the nursing service and nursing education programs of a health care setting or diagnostic and treatment center; performs related tasks.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:** 

1. Develops, establishes and implements the philosophy, objectives, policies and standards of the Nursing Department.

2. Organizes the Nursing Department to delineate authority, functional responsibilities and lines of communication. Coordinates functions of nursing services with other disciplines, collaborates with administrative staff, other department staff and representatives of allied groups in planning services.

3. Determines staffing requirements in relation to patient care standards and develops procedures to maintain an adequate, competent nursing staff.

4. Maintains a system of continuing evaluation of nursing service provided for patients.

5. Maintains up-to-date policy procedure manuals for all nursing units and evaluates their effectiveness.

6. Establishes an effective system of clinical and administrative nursing records and reports.

7. Directs the preparation of the personnel, equipment and supply budgets for the Nursing Department.

8. Directs the development and implementation of orientation, training and continuing education programs for nursing personnel.

9. Initiates and participates in studies and research projects. Utilizes findings to improve patient care and administrative services.

10. Plans for and coordinates use of clinical facilities by colleges and other agencies for nursing education purposes.

11. Participates in the development of policies and health programs for the health care setting and System policies and programs involving nursing.

12. Develops and maintains sound relationships with the community, labor and professional groups in developing nursing programs and policies.

13. May serve as a consultant for the System for the overall nursing practice, service and education programs; conducts related studies and directs projects, provides leadership in Central Office in the development, coordination and evaluation of System’s central and health care setting nursing services, practice and education programs.

14. Attends community conferences and committee meetings with administrative, Medical Board and department heads.

15. Conducts and chairs staff meetings and working committees with all levels of nursing personnel.

title: Clinical Research Associate - Imaging
description:
**This role is subject to a flexible hybrid work arrangement requiring a minimum of 1-2 pre-determined days per week in our mid-town office.**

**SUMMARY**

Under general supervision and within the framework of Phase I-IV clinical trials, is responsible for performing a series of qualitative and quantitative analyses of patient angiographic films.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

* Checks materials sent to the Core Lab for completion of Technician’s Worksheet, patient identification code, clinical site identification number, initial procedure data and identification of catheter used for micrometry.
* Assesses consistency between the film and the Technician’s Worksheet on filming of the catheter, correctness of designated segments and overall quality of filmed projections.
* Selects film frames that are most suitable for analysis and recording selected frames on Case Report Form.
* Records any deficiencies in angiographic acquisition on the feedback sheet.
* Traces/draws pre-interventional arterial segment on Case Report Form and recording the corresponding frame number and projection (angulation and skew) on Case Report Form.
* Records measurement and location of catheter on Case Report Form.
* Records baseline, final, and other selected time point morphology on the Case Report Form.
* Upon successful completion of approximate 3 month training period, proceeds with quantitative coronary analysis (QCA) process utilizing the Coronary Measurement System (CMS) including: image acquisition, image calibration and segment selection.
* May conduct peripheral analyses in addition to the above coronary analyses.
* May be trained on and expected to conduct quality assurance (QA) steps.
* Additional duties as assigned.

**QUALIFICATIONS**

* B.S. Degree in Biology or other Life Science. Medical background preferred.
* 0 - 2 years working experience in a medical, academic or pharmaceutical environment.
* Knowledge of medical terminology and morphology of the heart preferred.
* Must be proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word, and Outlook.
* Strong focus on flexibility, ability to multi-task, attention to detail, excellent organizational skills, good follow-up and judgment. Must be able to prioritize.
* Ability to verbally communicate effectively with staff, physicians, nurses, managers, trial sponsors and colleagues. Ability to communicate effectively when reading and writing e-mail, letters, Manual of Operations, Case Report Forms and other reports or company documents.
* Ability to analyze information and solve problems relating to images viewed on angiographic patient films and on case report forms.

**BENEFITS**

* Choice of health plans include medical, Dental, and vision coverage
* Company-paid short-term and long-term disability and life insurance
* Health and dependent care flexible spending accounts
* Pre-tax travel expenses through TransitChek program
* 401(k) plan
* Generous paid time off (PTO)
* Ten paid holidays each year

description:

title: Veterinarian
description:
**This role requires working fulltime on-site at the Skirball Center for Innovation based in Orangeburg, New York.**

**SUMMARY**

The Veterinarian provides daily veterinary care at SCI, provides preventive and ongoing clinical veterinary care for all SCI laboratory animals; oversees the anesthesia and surgical programs of the Center; and maintains all practices in accordance with AAALAC, USDA, OLAW and NY State Department of Health standards.

**ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**

· Provides veterinary care to all SCI laboratory animal species under supervision of the Director, Operations.

· Assists in maintaining a comprehensive surgical and clinical veterinary care program that assures appropriate animal welfare, and provides high quality animal health care and support for a rapidly expanding pre-clinical research program focused on cardiovascular device development and testing, and the investigation of novel therapies for the treatment of cardiovascular disease.

· Prepares and maintains a variety of records concerning physical examinations and diagnostic decisions ensuring compliance with study protocols and applicable regulations.

· Participates in training and educational activities involving the use of animals for the SCI veterinary staff and research team.

· Maintains interest in pursuing postgraduate training in laboratory animal medicine, and the training of veterinary students and post-doctoral associates.

· Engages in multidisciplinary research activities including developing animal models, testing, analysis and publications with particular focus on veterinary cardiovascular medicine.

· Maintains high professional standards.

· Acts to promote the interests of the Foundation.

· Provides guidance to technical veterinary staff and makes clinical decisions under the direction of the Director, Operations.

· Assures compliance with the study protocol and any protocol amendments.

· Records observations onto appropriate record forms.

· Ensures adequate sanitary and health care precautions for all SCI research animals.

· Documents any circumstance that may affect animal welfare, and/or the quality and integrity of a study.

· Reports any health or medical condition that may adversely affect a study to the Director, Operations, Manager of Animal Care and Principal Investigator.

· Additional duties as assigned

**DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES IN GLP STUDIES**

· Participates in study protocol development, approval and amendments as required.

· Assures GLP compliance in the area of animal health by providing personnel oversight and documentation review.

· Examines animals upon receipt and during the study for routine health evaluations and medical emergencies

· Performs or oversees the performance of animal health care assessment prior to release for study enrollment in both non-GLP and GLP studies, and during the in-life phase of all pre-clinical studies.

· Oversees all aspects of health assessment and health management of study animals, including diagnostic and therapeutic decisions, in communication with veterinary staff and study directors.

· Participates in all aspects of veterinary care at SCI and satellite facilities.

· Performs, or oversees performance of veterinary diagnostic and therapeutic procedures in study animals as required.

· Performs or assists in necropsies as required.

· Compiles, organizes and prepares, or oversees the compilation, organization and preparation of animal health-related data for final report preparation.

· Documents any circumstances that may affect animal welfare, and the quality and integrity of a study and assesses the impact on study outcome.

· Assures corrective actions in the animal care and veterinary arena are made in a timely manner and documented in an appropriate manner.

· Reviews clinical pathology results and health records of laboratory animals involved in both non-GLP and GLP studies. Communicates findings to veterinary staff and study directors as appropriate.

**QUALIFICATIONS**

· DVM/VMD degree from an AVMA accredited institution or equivalent.

· Veterinary licensure in at least one state required (NY State preferred).

· USDA Veterinary Accreditation required.

· 3-5 years of work experience in companion animal or mixed animal (sheep or swine preferred) clinical practice highly desired.

· Experience in an animal research environment is desired but not mandatory

· Must be proficient in Microsoft Excel, Word, and Outlook. Knowledge of Microsoft products and any animal facility-related software.

· Strong focus on flexibility, ability to multi-task, attention to detail, excellent organizational skills, good follow-up and judgment. Must be able to prioritize.

· Must possess excellent communication and writing skills, patience, professionalism and ability to effectively interact with staff and management alike.

· Ability to analyze complex information and solve problems relating to the proper care of laboratory animals.

**BENEFITS**

· Choice of health plans include medical, Dental, and vision coverage

· Company-paid short-term and long-term disability and life insurance

· Health and dependent care flexible spending accounts

· Pre-tax travel expenses through TransitChek program

· 401(k) plan

· Generous paid time off (PTO)

· Ten paid holidays each year

**COMPENSATION**

The hiring range for this position is $125,000 - $155,000. The annual salary that will ultimately be offered to the successful candidate will depend on job-related knowledge, education, skills, and experience.

**CONTACT INFORMATION**

To be considered for this opportunity, please submit your resume.

Be sure and visit our web site to learn more about how we strive to enhance and save patient lives every day www.crf.org

***CRF is an equal opportunity employer.***

title: Assistant Director of Nursing, Labor & Delivery
description:
Under direction of the Chief Nursing Officer, with the broadest scope for the exercise of independent initiative and judgment, organizes, directs, coordinates and evaluates the nursing service and nursing education programs of a health care setting or diagnostic and treatment center; performs related tasks.

**Essential Duties and Responsibilities:** 

1. Develops, establishes and implements the philosophy, objectives, policies and standards of the Nursing Department.

2. Organizes the Nursing Department to delineate authority, functional responsibilities and lines of communication. Coordinates functions of nursing services with other disciplines, collaborates with administrative staff, other department staff and representatives of allied groups in planning services.

3. Determines staffing requirements in relation to patient care standards and develops procedures to maintain an adequate, competent nursing staff.

4. Maintains a system of continuing evaluation of nursing service provided for patients.

5. Maintains up-to-date policy procedure manuals for all nursing units and evaluates their effectiveness.

6. Establishes an effective system of clinical and administrative nursing records and reports.

7. Directs the preparation of the personnel, equipment and supply budgets for the Nursing Department.

8. Directs the development and implementation of orientation, training and continuing education programs for nursing personnel.

9. Initiates and participates in studies and research projects. Utilizes findings to improve patient care and administrative services.

10. Plans for and coordinates use of clinical facilities by colleges and other agencies for nursing education purposes.

11. Participates in the development of policies and health programs for the health care setting and System policies and programs involving nursing.

12. Develops and maintains sound relationships with the community, labor and professional groups in developing nursing programs and policies.

13. May serve as a consultant for the System for the overall nursing practice, service and education programs; conducts related studies and directs projects, provides leadership in Central Office in the development, coordination and evaluation of System’s central and health care setting nursing services, practice and education programs.

14. Attends community conferences and committee meetings with administrative, Medical Board and department heads.

15. Conducts and chairs staff meetings and working committees with all levels of nursing personnel.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $140,000.00 - $150,000.00 per year
